website_summaries.verdict: A grain-free cat food that delivers a great blend of taste and nutrition.
pros: Contains high-quality animal proteins and no wheat, soy, or corn proteins
Filled with protein to boost energy
Boasts a meaty flavor that most cats  enjoy
cons: Includes a high level of phosphorous

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my cat with allergies.
customer_reviews.text: My cats Loved the taste. Unfortunately, it's not truly grain free, and my cats lip got very swollen as he is allergic to grains. So I had to discontinue using this product. I would not recommend it as a grain free cat food if your cat has allergies. But as regular cat food, yes.
customer_reviews.author: Smart_Savy_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Finicky Princess Kitty Approves of Crave Kitty Food
customer_reviews.text: My cat is actually commanding me to write this review. She is a Princess of the highest feline order and finicky doesn't begin to describe her taste in food much less anything else! She loves this brand - as soon as I put it in the bowl she came running up with tail up all happy and crunched her way into a kitty food coma afterward. She's an adult indoor Ginger Tabby and I've tried every conceivable food. She likes very few. For whatever reasons, this was a hit, so it will be a regular on our shelves.
customer_reviews.author: ThisMissMolly

customer_reviews.title: I usually go through bags of other brands of cat food pretty quickly. I saw this brand some months ago ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two Maine Coon mix cats. Not only are they fluffy but big cats in general which means bigger appetites. I usually go through bags of other brands of cat food pretty quickly. I saw this brand some months ago and thought I would try it. They love it! Their fur is shinier, also noticed less fur balls happening. I don't go through the bags of food as often as I was before. Price especially for the bigger bag is a little high but I'm willing to still purchase it since my cats love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen A

customer_reviews.title: Makes my cats sick
customer_reviews.text: After slowly introducing my cats to this food, both have taken to vomiting & diarrhea. No other dry foods cause my cats to vomit. Have over $50 worth of food in their pail that all needs to be thrown away thanks to this food. Brought to the vet and confirmed they were in fact sick due to food so I'm not just making assumptions. Not worth the risk for a "high end" brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Shank

customer_reviews.title: Glad I only bought a small pack to try
customer_reviews.text: Made my cats really sick. Glad I only bought a small pack to try out
customer_reviews.author: Marta Knitter-LeDuff

customer_reviews.title: I will never feed this to my cats
customer_reviews.text: Too many harmful chemicals such as DL-methionine, and potassium chloride (this is used for lethal injections).
customer_reviews.author: Grace Q.

customer_reviews.title: What happened???
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a third bag of this food. I had switched to it because the quality of my previous brand has been declining and my cats throw it up. The first two bags were fine, a lot less vomiting and no problem switching over. But my cats, all three of then, will not touch this last bag. Not one crumb, they have gone days without eating. I bought a bag of grocery store stuff, they dived into it but puked up a lot of it. What is wrong with this bag of Crave?
customer_reviews.author: linda mccormack

customer_reviews.title: Kitty and Human approved
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this at our local supermarket for our kitten after he didn't seem to like the food the shelter was feeding him and our two other cats both immediately started stealing his food. Although our two other cats are on prescription food, we mix this in because they all seem to love it. We love it because it doesn't give them terrible kibble breath like some other food does and it makes a surprisingly small mess. when they chew it breaks apart without any crumbs unlike so many other foods, and it doesn't leave any film on their bowls either which is wonderful considering it's a fish based food and can be rather oily.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Rofidal

customer_reviews.title: cat throws up immediately after eating
customer_reviews.text: cat shuld not throw up after eating supposedly healthy food. even a small portion would make it throw up. Are you sure your formula is good for cats? Where can we check the scientific references? And any Veterinarian references?
customer_reviews.author: Ivars Stonins

customer_reviews.title: My cats said ‘no way, dude’
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been feeding my cats Halo dry cat food for quite a while and they both love it but it’s expensive. I saw the great reviews for this food and gave it a try. Both of them quite literally RAN away from the bowls after smelling this food. I thought that was strange. I left it in the bowl for about 24 hours just to see if they’d change their minds after actually trying it. They decided they’d rather be hungry than eat it so this food is a no-go for us. 😕
customer_reviews.author: RCBLAKE

customer_reviews.title: What do we have here?
customer_reviews.text: Well I was surprised..had bought the dog version for my dog..and everytime I fed the dog my cat was trying to get at his food..i thought ok..I'll get you your own..so got this..put in her bowl..she just walked away..so I dont know..but what really surprised me was the fact that the dog food and cat food look exactly alike..same color shape everything..is it the same food just in a different bag..idk..point being..either the dog food should be bigger bites...or the cat food food should be smaller bites...cat and dog jaw strength..two different things..no wonder my black lab eats so fast..he's eating cat food..no chewing involved..where the cat can barely fit it in her mouth...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the stores!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this cat food received off Amazon. I have purchased this brand for years and it's always been rich in color and smell and my cats love it. I was apprehensive about purchasing off Amazon, but gave it a chance. Once I opened it I could tell immediately that this is a different formula or old/expiree. It was much lighter in color and my cats won't touch it. It doesn't even smell the same. I am extremely disappointed with this purchase and will never purchase food items off Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Rrrrooooaaarrrr
customer_reviews.text: Cats turned into a beast and doesn't want to eat anything other than crave. Seriously shes like mid 20s on the scale. Hoping she doesn't turn into the tiger on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: k-rudy

customer_reviews.title: Something Addictive is in this
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what was put in this food to make it this way but ever since I started this first (and last) bag of CRAVE it has made my cats ravenous--almost like an addiction. They want to be fed several hours in advance and I am feeding the recommended portion too. I will NOT be buying this again. CRAVE needs to change their name to CRACK.
customer_reviews.author: endiazherself

customer_reviews.title: Bad Choice
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for this high priced cat food, but ALL of our cats (both inside and out) refused to even touch it. Even the feral cats we have around the neighborhood would not eat it! We thought it would be a success for our kitties based on the other reviews we read, but be cautious. I would avoid this food, because it would be a waste of your money. We are having to throw out a whole 4lb bag of Salmon and Ocean Fish flavor because none of the pets will eat it. I will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I filled up my cat's food dispenser and poured the entire contents of the bag inside. My day was vomiting constantly after this purchase. I won't ever buy pet food online ever again.
customer_reviews.author: David Alfaro

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t think my kitten was picky...
customer_reviews.text: ...but he does not go near this food unless it’s mostly mixed with wet cat food. I’ve been worried about him not eating it so I got some wet cat food (which he loves) and prefers over this stuff. I brought some of the cat food my mom feeds her cat home just to see, and he gobbled it right up. It doesn’t really smell like chicken, and has a pretty strong kibble smell. Packaging and ingredients are great, just not for us!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: ... but my Siamese who is sensitive to grains did terrible on this food
customer_reviews.text: I know this is supposed to one of the more healthy cat foods but my Siamese who is sensitive to grains did terrible on this food. By the time she was down to the bottom of the bag, her fur looked terrible. And over-all she looked really unhealthy, she's been back on Taste of the Wild for a while now and looks great again. So no more switching cat foods for me, her health isn't worth it. My tabby cat who is a little bit of a fatty did just fine on it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Food, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: We have looked at many cat foods and this one has been the best. The protein content is great for cats, the price is great for a quality food, and our picky cat likes it even more than his canned food. To date I haven't seen any recalls on this or the dog food and our 9 year old cat still acts like a demented kitten - complete with presents captured from outside (sometimes non-recognizable). I highly recommend this food.
customer_reviews.author: Ponkow

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats went bananas for this! I saved half the bag to give as 'treats' and mixed the other half into their food bin. They love the flavor and seem to be eating more in general. it's nice to see a dry cat food that actually seems to be at the top health wise. It's expensive but worth adding in occasionally even if you can't all the time.
customer_reviews.author: jessica jones

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love it!
customer_reviews.text: Received first order but bag was open and it was all in bottom of shipping box. Gave to friend who feeds a stray. Amazon prime great, no questions asked and I reordered and received ok. I feed kitties Crave pate wet food and this. All very healthy since feeding higher protein no grain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They all loved it so much that when I ran out and ...
customer_reviews.text: Crave indoor Grain Free is what I will be feeding my cats from now on. They all loved it so much that when I ran out and used their backup brand, they would barely touch it! The ingredients are nutritious for them, and the shape of the food seemed to be easier for them to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn G.

customer_reviews.title: Heres the ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food but something I noticed is that the ingredients list was not easy to find. I have a cat with many allergies. This leads to much guess work as to what foods I can buy her.
customer_reviews.author: Amee Lee

customer_reviews.title: I love that it’s grain free
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I’ve been buying this for my cat for several months and he loved it. But the last 3 months he would not stop throwing up his food and when we decided to change his food it completely stopped. Somewhere along the way i think something in the recipe must have changed because 6 months no problems and then out of no where- very sick cat. I switched to Nutrish by Rachel Ray and have had no problems sinice. My cat won’t eat anything else! I love that it’s grain free. I did a lot of research into brands and ingredients before deciding on a brand/food and couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Erickson

customer_reviews.title: ... my 4 cats over to grain free Whole Foods like Crave and their energy level increases
customer_reviews.text: I switched my 4 cats over to grain free Whole Foods like Crave and their energy level increases, their skin rashes began clearing up with our medication. One of cats had been mucousy and within 2 days of switching over they already were was healthier. I know it’s expensive but we are what we eat. And that goes for animals too. Food can be medicine. 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rae Mcalpin

customer_reviews.title: The cats try to open the bag thenselves!
customer_reviews.text: Of my cats is diabetic now, but being elderly, we have tried many foods that are healthy options without grain, and they have been unimpressed. My cats are very picky eaters. I decided to try this, and they were both trying to open the bag! They normally have much better manners about this. I mixed this in with their prescription and bingo, they are enjoying their food again! Thank you so much for a great food my cats finally love!
customer_reviews.author: TriumphGal

customer_reviews.title: Cats won't eat it. Kibbles too big?
customer_reviews.text: It's probably good, but these middle age brothers here won't touch it. They eat wet food every day, but also eat dry food is for snacks in-between meals. I divided the dry food in their big snack bowl half-Crave, half-Friskies. Nobody has yet eaten any of the bits on the Crave side. Perhaps the bits are too big. Like most cats who are well fed, they are fussy, fussy, fussy. The dogs liked it, but they like most everything.
customer_reviews.author: C Southpaw

customer_reviews.title: All cats LOVE, picky eaters too
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats. All different breeds and ages. Some are very picky. However, they all absolutely love this food! It's a purrfect grain free option for your four legged kids. Even though I keep food in their dishes at all times, I have to keep this in a cabinet because they will tear into the bag at night. I recently had to switch one of my cats to a medical food because of his urinary problems, and he is very upset and misses his Crave food. Just make sure if you switch your cat's food, you do at least a week-long transition so they don't get upset stomach.
customer_reviews.author: bajaleah

customer_reviews.title: Best dry cat food - at least for my three cats
customer_reviews.text: I have three young cats ( almost 1 year old) who simply love this dry food over all the others. I was impressed that they actually have a preference, because i have tested 10 different popular brands. This is what the want and they get excited when I fill their bowls with it. I also offer at least one other dry food, but my cats generally ignore them. My cats are 6 lbs, 11 lbs, and one is 14 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mac_Cat

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients, price and palatability.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a cat food that isn't made of human food waste products and is affordable and the cats all like! (We have 4 with various tastes, but they all agree on THIS!)
customer_reviews.author: Bar-K

customer_reviews.title: Ruined Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: This VERY EXPENSIVE cat food is my cats favorite. He has allergies and this is the one food he tolerates well. However I just opened the box and found the food loose in the box with some grease stains on the cardboard. Romeo ate the last of his last bag this morning so now I have no food. I can tape up the bag and return it unless you can assure me the quality has not been compromised in any way. Please advise.( the first photo is my cat trying to get in the box to eat the spilled food.)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it and that's what matters.
customer_reviews.text: I have no real clue how healthy this is outside of the vets nodding their heads and not telling me to stop. The bag says it's healthy! We now leave this out to graze and feed some canned food twice a day. Petco and Target stopped selling this by me but amazon had it. I currently have been using Wellness and my cat has been eating it just fine but switched over and she won't go back to Wellness.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Just try it
customer_reviews.text: Four cats with various health and aging issues. Switched from a prescription plan to Crave. Thyroid issues resolved, diabetes issue controlled, allergy problems no longer a problem and overeating and purging no longer a problem
customer_reviews.author: Chris A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: All three of our cats ate this food for months, but at one point seemed to be through with it. Switched to another brand and they've been happy for months with that. As we all know, they're cats, and they will change their minds at random. You can feel safe in trying this brand. They have good ingredients, but make sure that you're giving your cat what it needs. This particular brand is high in protein, but not all cats need that or can tolerate it.
customer_reviews.author: mattroffact

customer_reviews.title: Excellent healthy cat food!
customer_reviews.text: High in protein..among the highest and no fillers. Lots and lots of premium cat food on the market many are outrageously priced. Crave hits the wickets for being affordable but at the same time being a great choice for those interested in the well being of cats. Have no had a single cat turn this stuff down. After a few weeks of being on this I noticed my cats fur was silky soft, shinny, and my cat was a healthy weight. Get it your cat will love you for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients at a great price
customer_reviews.text: My cat sometimes has problems digesting other grain free cat food. He's never had any problems with this brand and he seems to really like it. The price is great too for a brand with quality ingredients. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good quality, affordable grain free cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Barton

customer_reviews.title: May not be best for sensitive tummies
customer_reviews.text: My kitty enjoyed the food and I like the size for teeth cleaning. Sadly, this food made her vomit on the third day of just adding a 1/4 portion to her current food for transition period. For her, I've found that foods with split peas and pea protein higher on ingredient list do not agree with her digestion. My 15 year kitty has been on Nutro Duck and Potato grain free for years and loves it, but Nutro has discontinued that formula and all of their grain free dry cat foods. Arg!! Will try to find another good quality brand with duck as the main ingredient. To try Taste of the Wild and American Journey brands.
customer_reviews.author: AK2NC

customer_reviews.title: High in protein and  great for stomach sensitive cats.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a very sensitive stomach and throws up 3-4 times a week. I purchased dry food that is “sensitive” for the stomach and he still was throwing up a few times a week. I took him for a sonogram and he had no anomalies on the scan. The vet recommended that I purchase a dry food high in protein, I purchased Crave dry food and not only does my cat love it, he also stopped throwing up. I swear by Crave food and highly recommend it for discerning cat owners.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Kitty heaven
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff. I was feeding him cheap kibble brands and he was leaving some in the bowl. Not this stuff. He literally chased the last few pieces around his bowl, and straight meow-yelled at me for more. He was getting a bit thin for not eating as he should so this brightens my spirits a lot. He looks so happy. I have been wanting to feed him the healthy stuff but couldn’t afford it before. It really smells almost appetizing lol. I’m so glad he likes it
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey De Dios

customer_reviews.title: Quality ingredients
customer_reviews.text: It is a quality product. My cat loves it. It feels good knowing my cat is eating nutritious food. It is hard to tell what is in pet food especially since we are all more knowledgable and aware about harmful ingredients but have a difficult time identifying them. Boy is my cat spoiled though :)
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Decent ingredients and kitties enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a dry food with decent ingredients and lower carbohydrates that the kitties will actually eat and enjoy. Found it! The flat round shape works well and they don't gag on it. They come running when they hear it hit their bowls. I don't free feed, so they get 3 distinct meals plus a couple of pieces for night-time snack. Everyone is happy!
customer_reviews.author: N. Ro

customer_reviews.title: my cat likesa the food but does not eat alot
customer_reviews.text: my cat likes it one day and not the next. she is not eating a whole lot of it so I am not sure if she really likes it. Ginger would walk by and sniff and go on to something else. I don't know if it is so good she does not want to eat it. It is like children they want the mac and cheese but not the vegetables. I had to change foods because she will not eat it. the smell and look seem to be good so i would say its a good good if i had to eat it but my cat say no.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Great cat food!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this food, and more importantly, my three cats love this food. I have had quite a hard time finding a food that all my cats would all eat until I tried this (and I have tried A LOT of different brands, flavors). One of my cats has food sensitivities I haven't been able to detect, and most foods cause him to throw up after eating, but not this flavor and brand. I just tried the Crave chicken flavor and he was throwing up right after eating.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: 16 year old cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old Turkish Van Roxy has some pretty specific taste, I've gotten her expensive organic food that she straight up rejects. Shes eaten Iams pretty much her entire life and we've found she doesn't like fish, only chicken and turkey. I forgot why I ended up buying Crave but I've found it to be her absolute favorite. Usually she meows for wet food as soon as she enters the kitchen but when Crave dry food is in her bowl shes just as happy.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Was ok until it wasn’t.
customer_reviews.text: This food is reasonably priced for the quality. I was feeding all my my cats this brand for a couple months. They all started throwing it up, it was consistent, every time they ate it. Not sure if it was due to the size of the kibble being small that they are swallowing it whole and eat it too fast, or if it’s due to something in this food. I switched brands and all of my cats are much more active now.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: My girls love Crave
customer_reviews.text: I'm very picky about what I feed my cats. I like them to have a decent amount of protein and not many "trash" ingredients. Crave is pretty good for those two things, at a good price. My girls (3 and 12) also like the Crave wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Works for All Three of Our Cats!
customer_reviews.text: It's great to finally find a cat food that works for all three of our indoor cats. I have one with sensitive intestines (ewww), one who throws up if he eats too fast (we put dice in his bowl & then he eats more slowly because he has to chase each piece) and one who is overweight. Yes, we are crazy people. If you are also this kind of crazy and are looking for a food that works well with a variety of cats - definitely give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats hated it
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky cat that only eats one kind of food. I have another that needs to be on a diet. I heard good things about this brand and thought I'd give it a try. My very picky cat vomited first go round with it. It was mixed with her normal food. My diet needy cat ate around it. Back to blue wilderness for me. This bag will go to the ferals in the community. We have LOTS of them. So, it won't be wasted. I have it 4 stars because it's not Craves fault that my cats are picky.
customer_reviews.author: tandag

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My cat is loving this. Needed to get away from the cheap brands but still stay in a budget. Update: he usually gets sick a lot from the meow mix we were giving him. He has not puked one time through the entire bag of crave.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Elliott

customer_reviews.title: So much left
customer_reviews.text: My cat seemed to like it at first but the last two weeks isn't really eating it and I feel like she's eating it because there's nothing else. There is so much left. She didn't get sick or anything she's just not eating it as much as before. I went to my local store to try another brand at a smaller size, told them about the issue and they told me they're not even stocking this brand anymore. Luckily my local shop understands that some pets can be picky and have a generous return policy. This just didn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: VinnyP

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and seems to not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I got this in a pinch for my Manx since Sam's Club stopped carrying the food I usually purchased. While my cat liked it and didnt seem to complain, it it way more expensive than competitors. The other thing is the pieces are bigger than most other dry foods, so amount you are buying vs weight is less. After this was about gone I decided on Blue Buffalo and it is a much better alternative and what I'll be purchasing from now on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Adopted kitten with Stomatitis/Auto-immune disease
customer_reviews.text: Never used this food before. This food is great for my newest member of the family who even gets sick on Wellness canned food. She can eat this and still have the energy she needs to play and be the adorable kitten she should be. I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: M. N. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Cased Bladder Stones in my Cat
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this food for the two years I have had my cats, and it is what they used with their previous owner. About a month ago, one of my cats started exhibiting symptoms of not being able to use the litter box. He had SIX bladder stones and it cost THOUSANDS of dollars in surgery overall. We weren’t sure what caused it until I got the stone analysis email. It was this food. There is something in it that most other cat foods done have. As soon as I got the email, I canceled all subscriptions and am throwing out all of it. If you love your cats, DON’T feed them this food.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: My kittens like it
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 kittens, one is 14wks old & the other is 12wks old. I've had them since they were 7wks and 5wks old, ever since I've had them ive been giving them Crave mixed with Whole Earth Farms for kitten. They like it, i wouldn't say love it because idk how they feel for it but they do eat it. They have the softest fur ever! My little 12wk old had really ugly nasty fur when i got her but now it super soft! 🥰
customer_reviews.author: Eloisa

customer_reviews.title: Do not feed your cat this!
customer_reviews.text: Cat immediately sick after beginning just a small amount of this food. I don't know how this product can be offered. I was searching for a high protein food to help with his weight issues, but was like a different cat after eating this once. A playful social perfectly healthy animal turned into a growling lethargic fluff ball. I felt like a horrible owner after giving him this. Just not worth the risk if you love your cat. I immediately threw the rest away and replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Sadly my Cats would not eat
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful that I had found a cat food that was reasonably price and came in different flavors. I purchased (2) bags of different flavors. One Chicken and Salmon and the other Turkey, Chicken and Duck. I have (2) cats and neither one would eat this food, it sat in their bowls for days until I had to throw it out. When offered to my dog who would eat cat food wet or dry in a blink of an eye, would not eat it, he sniffed it and walked away. I will be donating the close to full bags to my local shelter, hopefully their cats will eat it??
customer_reviews.author: olindaa

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but healthy
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality, hate the cost. But what can you do. Cat loves it. I was worried about my cats diet and him getting enough nutrients, so I got him a better quality food. I think this did the trick. Wish there was a better deal or package though. I would definitely buy more in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat took one smell and walked away
customer_reviews.text: I know that cats are picky eaters; however this is the first dry food I have tried that my cat actually turned up her nose at. So the one star is my guess as to why she totally rejected this; but she is not talking, so it is just my guess.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Best cat food yet!
customer_reviews.text: DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS CAT FOOD! -Great ingredients (less fillers and more protien to keep your fur babies healthy) -amazing flavor for the cats (at least my cats love the taste of this way more than any other cat food) -buying on Amazon and using the subscribe and save allows you to save a lot more! I always get the largest size to get more bang for my buck -makes you feel like a badass cat parent for taking care of your babies and giving them what they need. TRY THIS OUT, YOU WILL THANK ME LATER!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Golden

customer_reviews.title: Best food for a picky eater
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a very picky eater, wont even eat treats. She will cry for this food. It's made her more playful and energetic, and she'll eat the whole bowl rather than picking at it threw out the day like normal.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy Grace

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite food
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many brands of higher end cat food, both dry and wet. I still give my cat wet food half the time just because I know it's good for him, but he doesn't like it much compared to this. He wolves this down immediately, where before he would eat a little bit then leave it, then come back when he was really hungry. He still does this with the wet food and eats it pretty slowly. This he eats so fast he nearly chokes. He goes crazy for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product At A Good Price
customer_reviews.text: My little girl is petite and she needs calories from protein not by products. i shopped around for similar products and way over priced. I took my girl off of it and she was losing weight--not good. I have her back on Crave now.
customer_reviews.author: francine

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have not personally eaten this product as its for my cat. But he loves the brand and it doesnt disagree with his belly. Other foods will make him sick. Only this and blue have settled for him but he likes this one over the blue so we get it. He has gotten healthy again sense he started on it. And our new rescue has been putting on the weight he lost before we brought him inside from the cold here. They love both the we and dry food.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: I feel more comfortable knowing my cats are getting healthier food
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for my cats to get used to this cat food. There's so many MSG's in regular cat foods that make them want to eat the food. They crave it. So when I switched to this food, they would sniff it and walk away. They eventually get hungry and started to eat it and now they eat it because they have to. I feel more comfortable knowing my cats are getting healthier food!
customer_reviews.author: fyergoddess

customer_reviews.title: Grain free
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. I like to give my cats snacks. I use this food as a snack, but I guess they don't find it as yummy as say, Fancy Feast. They eat some n leave the rest. Not gonna keep buying this one. They like other flavor a little better
customer_reviews.author: S.S.C.

customer_reviews.title: An affordable (and tasty) grain-free option
customer_reviews.text: I did some research to find an affordable, high-quality cat food and this seemed like the best option. My cat LOVES the salmon flavor and actually eats everything in her bowl (previously I was giving her Science Diet and never finished it). I feed her 1/2 cup per day (plus wet food) and she is the perfect weight with a shiny coat. I just wish they had a weight control formula because I need that for my two older cats.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Gave cat gastritis
customer_reviews.text: Only gave my cat 5 kernels of this on two consecutive days ( 10 total kernels) to start the food transition and she LOVED it but her gut didn't. She spent the next two days vomiting and had bloody diarrhea. The second day she was vomiting every hour and the vet said she had a fever and gastritis from the food and put her on an antibiotic and told me never to give her the food again.
customer_reviews.author: Vervain

customer_reviews.title: Love the cat food, but one bad bag arrived
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product on subscribe and save for months with no issues. Today the item was shipped in a smaller box made just for its shape (which didn't look like it had any damage), but the bag had a whole cut in the side. I don't know if this had anything to do with fitting it in the box or just happened to be a cut bag that got past quality control, but check your bags!
customer_reviews.author: Cinged

customer_reviews.title: Picky Cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats ran from this food like I was feeding them poison. Lol , it sat and it sat and they gave it a wide berth when walking by the bowl. I gave it to my friend and her cats loved it. That's why I gave it 4 stars. Because my cats hate everything so I'm not judging it by them.
customer_reviews.author: audrey

customer_reviews.title: MY TWO KITTY KATS LOVE THIS STUFF
customer_reviews.text: GEORGE MY 21 LB. KITTY ALWAYS WENT CRAZY WHEN DADDY WUZ DRINKING HIS PROTEIN SHAKE IN THE MORNING BEFORE WORK,++++++=== NO MORE NOW. HE HAS PROTEIN IN HIS BOWL. I AM SUBSCRIBE AND SAVE FOR THIS PRODUCT AND ALSO AM GONNA TRY THE PATE TO SEE IF THEY'LL ALSO EAT THAT !!! VERY PICKY EATERS !!!!!!!!!! THANKS FOR MAKING A GOOD PRODUCT FOR MY FINEEEKEEEY KITTY KATS.
customer_reviews.author: SiouxzQ

customer_reviews.title: Great! Now I have to buy another bag!
customer_reviews.text: I was using this earlier this year, but got conned by a tv commercial. The tv food went over so well, one of my cats kept trying to bury it. I reordered this, but wanted to use up the other. After very loud weird noises, I have up. They were trying (and succeeding) in opening this bag. The foot dish had constant activity since I filled it with the Crave.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY KITTIES!
customer_reviews.text: I hate that it asks me to rate the flavor, as if I'm the one eating it...but considering I keep buy this dry food, in assuming my cats like the flavor. The bag is fairly big and lasts awhile. I mix it with the other Crave flavors so it lasts much longer that way. Also, my dog tends to get the cat food if I don't put it away and he eats it up too so I guess he likes the flavor as well.
customer_reviews.author: K9-TRIGUN

customer_reviews.title: 4 paws up!
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding this to my cat for years and he loves it. It’s probably right between the most expensive in the least expensive cat food, and I think it has quality ingredients. I can’t comment on the flavor because I’ve not really tried it, but Gary gives it four paws up.
customer_reviews.author: jdub

customer_reviews.title: my cat ran from the bowl of this cat food, literally.
customer_reviews.text: my cat would not even go near this food. i notice it has no odor and the kibbles are very big i don't know why my cat does not like it. if i bring her to the bowl she literally runs from it. geez i see it had mostly good reviews so i bought it. but with cats you never know. no rhyme or reasons to what they like or don't like.
customer_reviews.author: nancy m orlando

customer_reviews.title: Siamese approved
customer_reviews.text: My cat seems to like it alright no complaints from her, it luckily doesn't make her stink up the house like some of the cheaper foods. I knocked off one star because this food literally smells like fish food and has an extremely strong odor!
customer_reviews.author: jlundin

customer_reviews.title: Good for Bengals & less odiferous ‘unsecured deposits’!
customer_reviews.text: We love this cat food! Especially the flavor including salmon. We have adopted an abandoned kitten who we are almost positive is a Bengal, this meets his need for protein and other nutrients. He is now strong, muscular, solid, and -as expected a mischievous. (Apparently it’s common for even purebred ‘undesirables’ to be dumped in our region. 😢) We also have two other feral/abandoned kitten rescues (all three are indoors and ~a year old) and their coats are beautiful and my favorite part .... their ‘unsecured deposits’ aren’t as rancid as the other brands we have tried!
customer_reviews.author: Drift

customer_reviews.title: Good but price change- now expensive
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this two months ago I paid $16.95 for a ten pound bag and I was so excited to try a grain free that I could afford. My cats seem to really like it and I am happy with it, but then I went to reorder and now it is $31.49 for a ten pound bag and I can no longer afford it so I have to switch them again. This is ridiculous to charge so much more in just two months.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love Crave
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and both of them just love this food. They both love the chicken flavor better than the fish. Walmart only carries the 5 LB bags. Amazon is the only place I could find that has the 10 LB bag. The 10 LB bags are rather expensive, but so are those five pound bags.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Beem

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food, and it’s healthier because it is high in protein and meat is the main ingredient. Wet food is the healthiest for cats, but she will only eat dry, so at least this is the healthiest dry, that I could find. Wish I could find one low in carbs, as well! Dry food causes cats to get fat, and have kidney problems.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Millard

customer_reviews.title: Cat can't stop eating it.
customer_reviews.text: I thought my cat was addicted to Taste of the Wild, then on a whim, I gave her some of this. She can't get enough of it. This morning she ate so much she threw up. This has never happened. I literally have to manage her portions with this or she'll just keep eating. This has never happened. It's like crack.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: A week after I started feeding my cat this food, she was covered in scabs, I threw it out, it’s garbage!
customer_reviews.author: jodie hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Gave my cat bladder stones
customer_reviews.text: Gave my cat urinary crystals after 6 months even on a mixed wet and dry food diet. Avoid!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beantown

customer_reviews.title: My bengal loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My bangle wasn’t a huge fan of numerous expensive cat food brands. This stuff put some weight on his skinny butt and he loves it. Also doesn’t seem to upset his stomach as most bengals have issues with ibs. Win. Win.
customer_reviews.author: elefriend02

customer_reviews.title: Not for specialty breeds
customer_reviews.text: Excellent nutritional facts! However this food gives my himalayan/siamese cat, cat acne. It took many months and elimination to narrow it down to all Crave branded dry food. With that said specialty breeds tend to be more prone to everything in general so it might be just fine for your cat!

customer_reviews.title: This May Be Too Good
customer_reviews.text: Ever since switching to this dry food brand, my cat won't shut up. He just can't get enough. I'm thinking about either switching to another brand or getting rid of the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Shortwaver

customer_reviews.title: My cats like it
customer_reviews.text: Though surely not the fan favorite they did scarf it up. But the morsels are a little hard for my senior kitties and the scent is strong. They ate it but they wanted something else. I would buy it again but only as a filler not as an always food.
customer_reviews.author: Imightyaphrodite

customer_reviews.title: My Voids Love It
customer_reviews.text: I switched my two fluffy voids from Blue Buffalo to CRAVE after doing research on higher quality cat foods. The main reason being that Taco (void #1) occasionally got sick from undigested kibble, and had been experiencing more hairballs than normal. All I can say, is that CRAVE delivers. They absolutely love the flavor, and the larger kibbles force them to chew more and not eat as fast. I can tell a noticeable difference in their coats, and the occasional hairball has all but stopped. If you love your kitties, they'll love CRAVE.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive!
customer_reviews.text: While my cats mostly liked this, the pieces are a bit too big & the price prevents me from feeding it as anything but a treat.
customer_reviews.author: MsPat

customer_reviews.title: Truly trust the quality of the food and my cat Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old princess absolutely loves this food. I tried another brand she refused to eat it. I even tried mixing it 50/50 she spit out the ones that she knew wasn't crave. I highly recommend this food for your fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: Cora-Lea

customer_reviews.title: My cat love this dry food
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for high protein dry food to give my one year old kitty a little nutrient boost and this was on sale the same time. At about $1.6/lb, this is still an affordable dry food. My cat immediately took the food and love it. my only concern is that this food is not as filling as the previous one, so I mixed a little and kitties still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tan

customer_reviews.title: "Crave" is True to its name!!
customer_reviews.text: I am representing my furbaby's views here. I have not tasted Crave myself but perhaps I should... I fostered Lily from 4 weeks. A "runt" she became known as she just would not eat. No matter the product or price. For a while albacore tuna appealed to her; never "light" OK. I thought Temptations were going to be the lady resort. Like an ice cream diet for picky kids. I found Crave. Skeptical on its deliver. BUT, sound the drums and trumpets!!! Lily has been craving it daily for a year now!! Maintaing great weight, energy, coat, playfulness, gastric health and charm. Now the treats are just that, and training motivators. BTW, Lily and are "forever" family.
customer_reviews.author: DesertJoy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! probubly 40% cheaper than in the store. Great product, great price. Our cat is a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Deadnightwarriorx

customer_reviews.title: Bought for feral colony; just so so
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my feral colony. They didn't like it as much as the cheap and unhealthy stuff I had been feeding them. It's too expensive for my purpose. The racoons and possums liked it, but they'll eat anything.
customer_reviews.author: Marc1

customer_reviews.title: Too small for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother buying this cat food. The bag is so small! I knew it was but really it won’t feed my cats for a week. And the scent of the food is horrible. I won’t buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Formula has changed
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the chicken Crave for years and my cats have loved it. The latest bag has changed shape and obviously the taste because now none of them will touch it. What’s with it?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Lovelle

customer_reviews.title: Seafood flavor a winner
customer_reviews.text: The only dry cat food that my cat will eat. Picky cat will only eat seafood flavored food, dry or wet, and the price point on this is better than the “designer foods” that I might otherwise have to try.
customer_reviews.author: SherryQ

customer_reviews.title: All 3 of my cats love this.
customer_reviews.text: I had my cats on Royal Canine kitten when they turned a year old I tried to move them to royal canine adult what a nightmare! They just threw it up. I tried even the sensitive one nope. I tried several cat food brands and they cats did not like it. I ordered this one and its wonderful. All 3 of the cats like it eat it and no throwing up!
customer_reviews.author: ablondmoment

customer_reviews.title: A Healthy Choice Dog
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Our dog is allergic to chicken and it is difficult to find a grain free product without chicken byproducts. Not only is this product grain free and byproducts, but our dog loves it and we know she is getting healthy food. Her coat is shiny and this product comes in different size bags which is very confident.
customer_reviews.author: Marg Wall

customer_reviews.title: Cat gobbles it up.
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves this food. I tried various premium grain-free brands that cost a lot more than this, and my cat simply would not eat them. I had never heard of this brand before, but decided to give it a try, and he loves it. Very pleased to have found this very inexpensive, grain-free food that my cat loves.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Dry Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: My Cat only has 4 paws, as expected, so he is giving this four paws up plus his tail to get to the 5 stars. Seriously, though, this is a really well thought out dry cat food that my cat will eat readily, and he is one of those picky eaters.
customer_reviews.author: S Stone

product_meta.title: CRAVE Grain Free High Protein Dry Cat Food
product_meta.description: Style:Adult| Flavor Name:Chicken & Salmon| Size:10 lb.Real chicken is the #1 ingredient in CRAVE protein-rich dry cat foods. Our recipes aren’t based on trends or buzzwords. Our recipes are based on primal, ancestral diets—inspired by wild cats, but formulated for little cats. With 40% protein, you can feed your indoor tabby’s inner wild cat the high protein, complete and balanced diet with essential nutrients for developing muscle, aiding in digestion, providing energy, and supporting healthy immune systems. Grain free—with NO corn, NO wheat, and NO soy protein.
feature_bullets: Contains One (1) 10 Lb. Bag Of Crave Grain Free Indoor Adult Dry Cat Food With Protein From Chicken & Salmon—Specially Formulated For Indoor Cats
Real Chicken Is The #1 Ingredient To Give Cats The Flavors They Love And The Protein-Rich Diets They Need
Grain Free Cat Food Recipes Are Inspired By Your Cat’S Natural, Ancestral Diet—Providing Energy From Quality Carbohydrate Sources
High Protein Cat Food Provides Cats With Essential Nutrients For Developing Muscle, Aiding In Digestion, And Supporting Healthy Immune Systems
Each Dry Cat Food Recipe Has No Chicken By-Product Meal, No Corn, No Wheat, And No Soy Protein
More Than Your Average Cat Kibble, Crave Cat Food Gives Your Cats The Complete And Balanced Diet They Need
